The British invasion of Maryland and Washington, D.C. during the War of 1812 is a defining period in U.S. history, marking the only occasion the country has been invaded by a foreign power. The Star-Spangled Banner National Historic Trail follows key events such as the British fleet's arrival in the Patuxent River, the American defeat at the Battle of Bladensburg, and the burning of the U.S. Capitol and White House during the siege of Washington, D.C. The British naval diversions in the upper Chesapeake Bay led to the Battle of Caulk's Field in Maryland. American troops traveled from Washington through various Maryland counties to the Battle of North Point, culminating in the victory at Fort McHenry on September 14, 1814. Francis Scott Key wrote the words that became the national anthem, the Star-Spangled Banner.
